column11: A 76-year-old woman came to our hospital because of hyperglycemia and proteinuria. A pre-retirement health check had pointed out that her blood glucose level was high, but she had left it untreated. She had not undergone a health check since she retired at age 60. She had gained 10 kg in weight in the year since she retired. There was nothing notable about her medical history. Her older sister has diabetes. She currently lives alone. She does not exercise regularly. She visited an ophthalmologist because of declining vision, and was diagnosed with proliferative diabetic retinopathy. She was also found to have hyperglycemia and proteinuria, and was referred to us. Height 154 cm, weight 70 kg. Pulse 72 beats per minute, regular. Blood pressure 142/80 mmHg. No abnormalities were found in the chest or abdomen. Mild pitting edema was present in both lower extremities. Urine findings: protein, sugar, occult blood. Spot urine protein/Cr ratio was 1.2 g/gCr. No red blood cells, white blood cells, or casts were found in the urinary sediment. Blood biochemistry findings: total protein 6.1 g/dL, albumin 4.2 g/dL, urea nitrogen 16 mg/dL, creatinine 0.6 mg/dL, eGFR 72.3 mL/min/1.73 m2, random blood glucose 201 mg/dL, HbA1c 10.2%, Na 142 mEq/L, K 4.5 mEq/L, Cl 100 mEq/L, Ca 9.2 mg/dL. Anti-GAD antibodies were negative. The patient did not wish to undergo a renal biopsy to determine the cause of the urinary protein. Which finding most likely suggests that the cause of this patient's proteinuria is diabetic nephropathy?

column4: Um paciente com 42 anos, assintomático, compareceu, pela primeira vez, a uma unidade básica de saúde (UBS), mencionando à médica de família e comunidade que ele havia se mudado recentemente para área de atuação da UBS. Na consulta, ele traz relatório médico do centro de atenção psicossocial (CAPS), informando o diagnóstico de esquizofrenia há 7 anos, sem crise nos últimos 3 anos, e uso de psicofármacos. O paciente relata que não usa outras medicações e que, há 1 mês, fez exames laboratoriais cujos resultados foram: glicemia de jejum: 189 mg/dL; colesterol total: 225 mg/dL; colesterol-HDL: 35 mg/dL; colesterol-LDL: 168 mg/dL. Por fim, queixa-se de ter começado a engordar desde o diagnóstico de esquizofrenia (índice de massa corporal atual: 36,2 kg/m²) e solicita a renovação da receita dos psicofármacos de que faz uso. column11: A 42-year-old asymptomatic patient came to a basic health unit (UBS) for the first time and told his family and community doctor that he had recently moved to the area covered by the UBS. At the appointment, he brought a medical report from the psychosocial care center (CAPS) stating that he had been diagnosed with schizophrenia for 7 years, had not had a crisis in the last 3 years, and was taking psychotropic drugs. The patient reported that he was not taking any other medications and that 1 month ago he had laboratory tests, the results of which were: fasting blood glucose: 189 mg/dL; total cholesterol: 225 mg/dL; HDL cholesterol: 35 mg/dL; LDL cholesterol: 168 mg/dL. Finally, he complained that he had started to gain weight since his diagnosis of schizophrenia (current body mass index: 36.2 kg/m²) and requested a renewal of the prescription for the psychotropic drugs he was taking. column12: Do not renew the prescription until the patient has been evaluated by a psychiatrist and weight loss measures have been initiated.

column14: Renew the prescription, carry out multidisciplinary follow-up at the expanded family health center, and initiate measures for metabolic control.
column15: Refer the patient to CAPS to renew the prescription, request an evaluation by a nutritionist and endocrinologist from the extended family health center.

column4: Uma paciente com 54 anos, portadora de nefropatia diabética em estágio 5 da KDIGO (do inglês Kidney Disease: Improving Global Outcomes), comparece ao ambulatório de nefrologia de hospital terciário, onde faz seguimento de sua terapia por diálise peritoneal ambulatorial contínua (CAPD) instituída há alguns meses. A paciente relata certo desconforto abdominal e aspecto turvo do líquido que é drenado de sua cavidade peritoneal. Nega febre ou outros sintomas e refere aumento de peso nas últimas semanas. Ao exame físico, a paciente se mostra normotensa, afebril, com dor leve à palpação abdominal difusamente. Exames laboratoriais que recentemente realizou revelam hiperglicemia e hipoalbuminemia. É coletado material da cavidade peritoneal, através do cateter de CAPD, para análise citológica e cultura para germes comuns. Acerca da condição que afeta essa paciente, assinale a opção correta.
column5: O quadro clínico mais comum é o descrito, sendo rara a presença de febre e de outros sintomas constitucionais.
column6: O diagnóstico provável do caso é sustentado apenas se estiverem presentes mais de 250 polimorfonucleares/mm3 no líquido analisado.
column7: A ocorrência de hiperglicemia e hipoalbuminemia é explicada pelo processo infeccioso, não podendo ser causadas tão somente pela CAPD.
column8: O tratamento do caso envolve a retirada do cateter de CAPD, caso a cultura para germes comuns isole um bastonete Gram-negativo hidrofílico, como a Pseudomonas sp.
column11: A 54-year-old patient with stage 5 diabetic nephropathy according to KDIGO (Kidney Disease: Improving Global Outcomes) presents to the nephrology outpatient clinic of a tertiary hospital, where she is undergoing continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis (CAPD) therapy, which was started a few months ago. The patient reports some abdominal discomfort and a cloudy appearance of the fluid drained from her peritoneal cavity. She denies fever or other symptoms and reports weight gain in recent weeks. On physical examination, the patient is normotensive, afebrile, with mild diffuse abdominal pain on palpation. Recent laboratory tests reveal hyperglycemia and hypoalbuminemia. Material is collected from the peritoneal cavity, through the CAPD catheter, for cytological analysis and culture for common germs. Regarding the condition affecting this patient, select the correct option.
column12: The most common clinical picture is the one described, with the presence of fever and other constitutional symptoms being rare.
column13: The probable diagnosis of the case is supported only if more than 250 polymorphonuclear cells/mm3 are present in the analyzed fluid.
column14: The occurrence of hyperglycemia and hypoalbuminemia is explained by the infectious process and cannot be caused solely by CAPD.
column15: Treatment of the case involves removal of the CAPD catheter if culture for common germs isolates a hydrophilic Gram-negative rod, such as Pseudomonas sp.

A mãe refere que, há aproximadamente 20 dias, ele vem perdendo peso (cerca de 5 kg). Ela relata ainda que o filho, embora tenha controle esfincteriano noturno desde os 5 anos, tem agora apresentado enurese noturna, desde o início do quadro. Conta também que, no mesmo período, passou a demonstrar apetite exagerado e que, há 5 dias, começou a apresentar dor abdominal de moderada intensidade, sem localização específica, intermitente, associada a náuseas e vômitos (1 vez ao dia). Ao exame físico, a criança se apresenta em regular estado geral, hipocorado (+1/+4), afebril, acianótico, mucosas secas, hipoativo, fácies de dor, normotenso. À ausculta pulmonar, não há ruídos adventícios; frequência respiratória de 50 incursões respiratórias por minuto, com movimentos respiratórios amplos; ausculta cardíaca sem alterações, frequência cardíaca de 90 batimentos por minuto; abdome doloroso à palpação profunda, com ruídos hidroaéreos presentes, sem massas ou visceromegalias. Após o manejo inicial, qual das opções a seguir apresenta o seguimento a longo prazo adequado para essa doença?
column5: O apoio familiar é fundamental para que o problema possa ser controlado, evitando-se as complicações, uma vez que se trata de uma doença crônica.
column6: O uso ambulatorial farmacológico com análogo sintético da vasopressina, associado ao tratamento psicológico com alarme, costuma levar à remissão do processo por volta dos 15 anos.

column11: An 8-year-old schoolboy, accompanied by his mother, comes to the primary health care unit complaining of being very tired and sleepy. The mother reports that he has been losing weight (about 5 kg) for approximately 20 days. She also reports that her son, although he has had good nighttime sphincter control since he was 5 years old, has now been experiencing nocturnal enuresis since the onset of the condition. She also reports that, during the same period, he began to show an excessive appetite and that, 5 days ago, he began to experience moderate abdominal pain, with no specific location, intermittent, associated with nausea and vomiting (once a day). On physical examination, the child is in good general condition, pale (+1/+4), afebrile, acyanotic, dry mucous membranes, hypoactive, with painful facies, and normotensive. On pulmonary auscultation, there are no adventitious sounds; respiratory rate of 50 respiratory incursions per minute, with wide respiratory movements; cardiac auscultation was normal, heart rate was 90 beats per minute; abdomen was tender on deep palpation, with bowel sounds present, and no masses or visceromegaly. column12: Family support is essential so that the problem can be controlled, avoiding complications, as it is a chronic disease.
column13: Pharmacological outpatient use with a synthetic analogue of vasopressin, associated with psychological treatment with an alarm, usually leads to remission of the process around the age of 15.
column14: Patients often experience periods of remission that usually last decades, known as the honeymoon period, and hormone replacement therapy is unnecessary at the end of these periods.
column15: Adopting a healthy lifestyle, a balanced diet and regular exercise are considered pillars of treatment, with long-term drug therapy being unnecessary.

Revisando consultas anteriores, o médico de família e comunidade identifica que a mãe já havia demonstrado preocupação, pois a criança ainda não apresentava sorriso social, não observava a mãe nem olhava nos seus olhos enquanto mamava, não se interessava por outras crianças, não respondia a chamados e não apresentava nenhum tipo de lalação. column5: optar por não prescrever a anticoncepcão oral, uma vez que a adolescente pretende usar pílula para evitar a gravidez e estará arriscada a contrair infecções sexualmente transmissíveis, caracterizando imaturidade psicológica e risco para si; ele deve reforçar, também, a prática sexual segura e, devido ao risco iminente à saúde da adolescente, está obrigado a informar os responsáveis sobre o motivo da consulta.

column4: رجل يبلغ من العمر 57 عاماً يحضر إلى عيادتك وهو يعاني من السعال لمدة أسبوعين. السعال مترافق مع قشع صافي، يحدث يومياً وهو مستمر على مدى الأسبوعين الماضيين. يحدث له ضيق تنفس وأزيز في أوقات مختلفة. هو ينفي أي ألم عضلات، وحمى، أو رعشة. لقد عانى من إنزعاج في الصدر بسبب السعال المفرط تاريخه الطبي السابق سلبي وهو لا يأخذ أي أدوية وينكر سابقة مرض رئوي. الحرارة 37.2 س، سرعة التنفس 18، إشباع الأوكسجين 96% في جو الغرفة. عند الفحص السريري، لم يكن المريض يعاني معاناة تنفسية وهو يتنفس بشكل مريح. يبدو من التسمع الرئوي غطاط متناثرة وأزيز ولكن دون تصلب، نفاخ، أو كركرة. تظهر الأشعة السينية للصدر توسع طبيعي للرئتين دون رشحة أو انصباب. ذروة التدفق هو 530 ليتر/د (المتوقع 556 ليتر / د). ما هو التدبير الأنسب؟
column11: A 57-year-old male presents to your office with a 2-week history of cough. The cough is associated with clear sputum, occurs daily and has persisted over the past 2 weeks. He has occasional dyspnea and wheezing at times. He denies myalgias, fevers, or chills. He has experienced chest discomfort due to excessive coughing. Past medical history is negative and he takes no medications and specifically denies any history of pulmonary disease. Temperature is 37.2°C. RR = 18. O₂ saturation is 96% on room air. On examination, the patient is in no respiratory distress and is breathing comfortably. Auscultation of lungs reveals scattered rhonchi and wheezing but no consolidation, egophony, or crackles. Chest X-ray shows normal expansion of the lungs without infiltrates or effusions. Peak flow is 530 L/min (expected 556 L/min). What is the most appropriate management?

column4: رجل يبلغ من العمر 32 عاماً، والذي انتقل مؤخراً إلى المنطقة. يحضر إلى عيادتك لأول مرة من أجل فحص روتيني. يبرز في تاريخه الطبي السابق داء سكري نمط II. طوله 175 سم ووزنه 98 كغ. الدواء الوحيد الذي يأخذه هو متفورمين. هو يدخن نصف علبة دخان يومياً، لا يتعاطى الكحول، ويمارس الرياضة بشكل متقطع، تقريباً مرة كل أسبوعين. لقد توفيت والدته عن عمر 62 عاماً بسبب احتشاء عضلة قلبية. والده يبلغ من العمر 73 عاماً وهو يتمتع بصحة جيدة. الفحص السريري طبيعي. العلامات الحيوية هي: ضغط الدم = 146/95، النبض = 73، سرعة التنفس = 19، الحرارة = 36.7 س. أي من التغيرات التالية في نمط الحياة قد ثبت أنه يؤدي إلى أكبر انخفاض في ضغط الدم؟
column5: النهج الغذائي لوقف ارتفاع ضغط الدم (DASH)
column11: A 32-year-old male, who recently moved to the area, presents to your office for the first time for a routine checkup. Past medical history is significant for type II diabetes mellitus. He is 175 cm and weighs 98 kg. The only medication he takes is metformin. He smokes half a pack of cigarettes a day; does not drink alcohol; and exercises sporadically, approximately once every 2 weeks. His mother died at the age of 62 due to a myocardial infarction. His father is 73 years of age and is healthy. Physical examination is normal. Vital Signs are: BP = 146/95, pulse = 73, RR = 19, temperature = 36.7°C. Which of the following lifestyle modifications has been shown to result in the greatest reduction in blood pressure?
column12: Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH) diet

column4: فتاة تبلغ من العمر 17 عاماً أدخلت إلى قسم الطوارئ بناء على طلب الطبيب، وهي تعاني من حرارة، عسر تبول وإقياء منذ 3 أيام. هي تنفي أي إفراز مهبلي، ألم بطني، أو إسهال. هي جنسياً مع خليلها. العلامات الحيوية كالتالي: الحرارة = 39.4 س، سرعة التنفس = 20، ضغط الدم = 65/98، النبض = 100. هي تبدو مريضة وغير قادرة على تحمل السوائل، لكن هي في حالة تأهب وتوجه. فحصها السريري إيجابي لألام ثنائي الجانب في الزاوية العانية والضلعية الفقرية. يظهر من تحليل البول العديد من كريات الدم البيضاء والجراثيم، وهو إيجابي لإسترارز كريات الدم البيضاء واسترات الكريات البيضاء. نتائج الفحوص المخبرية الأخرى هي ضمن الحدود الطبيعية، بما في ذلك فحص حمل بول سلبي. ما هو التشخيص المرجح؟
column11: A 17-year-old female is referred to the emergency department by her primary physician; she presents with a 3-day history of fevers, dysuria, and vomiting. She denies vaginal discharge, abdominal pain, or diarrhea. She is sexually active with her boyfriend. Vital Signs are as follows: Temperature = 39.4°C, RR = 20, BP = 98/65, pulse = 100. She appears ill and is unable to tolerate liquids, but she is alert and oriented. Her examination is positive for suprapubic as well as costovertebral angle tenderness bilaterally. Urinalysis reveals numerous white blood cells and bacteria, and it is positive for white blood cell casts and leukocyte esterase. Other laboratory study results are within normal limits, including a negative urine pregnancy test. What is the likely diagnosis?

column4: رجل يبلغ من العمر 32 عاماً يحضر إلى قسم الطوارئ مع شكوى من ألم شديد في أسفل الظهر لـ 5 أسابيع الماضية. هو يفيد أن الألم هو أكثر شدة عندما يستيقظ أولاً في الصباح ويتحسن تدريجياً مع النشاط على مدار اليوم. هو لا يمكن أن يتذكر أي رضة أو أذية على ظهره عند بدء الألم. هو ينفي أي ألم أو خدر في الأطراف السفلية. وظيفة الإمعاء والمثانة طبيعية. يظهر الفحص الفيزيائي رجل يعاني من زيادة وزن متوسطة وبعض الكرب. هو يعاني من إيلام قليل جداً عند الجس في أسفل ظهره. الفحص العصبي طبيعي. ما هي الخطوة التالية الأنسب في تدبير هذا المريض؟
column11: A 32-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a complaint of severe low back pain for the last 5 weeks. He reports that the pain is most severe when he first wakes up in the morning and gradually improves with exercise throughout the day. He cannot recall any trauma or insult to his back when the pain started. He denies any pain or numbness in the lower extremities. Bowel and bladder function is normal. Physical examination reveals a moderately overweight male in some distress. He has very minimal tenderness on palpation of his low back. Neurologic examination is normal. What is the appropriate next step in managing this patient?

column4: رجل يبلغ من العمر 29 عاما مع تاريخ من الربو يحضر إلى قسم الطوارئ وهو يعاني من ضيق تنفس شديد على مدى اليومين الماضيين. هو يشكو أيضا من التهاب الحلق، وتوعك عام، وسعال غير منتج. هو ينفي ألم، حمى، أو رعشة. الحرارة = 37.1°س، سرعة القلب = 95، سرعة التنفس = 33، ضغط الدم = 82/140، إشباع أوكسجين = 90% في جو الغرفة. التنفس مجهد وكلامه بنبرات قصيرة. يظهر تسمع الرئة انتشار أزيز زفيري منتشر ثنائي الجانب. لا يوجد شرى أو وذمة وعائية عند فحص الجلد. غاز الدم الشرياني: 7.42/43/70/22. ما هو التدبير العلاجي الأنسب لهذا المريض؟
column5: تطبيق حذر للأوكسجين، استهداف SaO2<94% لمنع فرط ثنائي أكسيد الكربون في الدم
column11: A 29-year-old male with a history of asthma presents to the emergency department with severe shortness of breath for the past 2 days. He also complains of sore throat, generalized malaise, and a nonproductive cough. He denies chest pain, fever, and chills. Temperature = 37.1°C, HR = 95, RR = 33, BP = 140/82, and O₂ saturation = 90% on room air. Breathing is labored, and he is speaking in short gasps. Lung auscultation reveals bilateral diffuse expiratory wheezing. There is no urticaria or angioedema on skin examination. Arterial blood gases is drawn: 7.42/43/70/22. What is the appropriate next step in managing this patient?
column12: Cautious oxygen administration, targeting an SaO₂<94% to prevent hypercapnia

column4: طفل يبلغ من العمر 5 سنوات يعاني من صعوبة في التنفس والبلع. عند الفحص السريري، تبين أن الطفل مصاب بحمى، تسرع قلب وتسرع تنفس. هو قلق، يسيل لعابه، وأصبح منهكا على نحو متزايد بينما هو يكافح من أجل التنفس. أي من التالي هو التدبير العلاجي الأنسب عند هذا المريض؟

column11: A 22-year-old female presents to the emergency department with abrupt onset of a rash, high fever, and vomiting. Vital signs are as follows: Temperature = 40°C, HR = 118, RR = 22, BP = 76/40, and pulse oximetry = 98% on room air. On examination, she appears confused and disoriented. Her skin is warm, and there is a diffuse macular rash over her body. She is admitted to the intensive care unit and subsequently develops multisystem organ dysfunction. Which of the following organisms is most likely implicated in this patient's diagnosis?

column4: رجل يبلغ من العمر 33 عاما حضر إلى العيادة وهو يعاني من الم الصدر لمدة 4 أيام. يمتد الألم نحو الجانب الأيمن من الرقبة وهو يسوء بالشهيق العميق ويتحسن بالميول إلى الأمام. قبل عدة أسابيع كان ملازما لحمى وسعال، تحسنا منذ ذلك الحين. هو غير حروري، ضغط الدم 130/85، والنبض 88. عند الفحص السريري، سمع خشخشة على الحدود القصية اليسرى عند الزفير. يظهر تخطيط القلب الكهربائي رفع ST في اتجاه I، II، III، aVL، وV2 إلى V6. لقد تم تقديم علاج لهذا المريض ولكنه رفض جميع الأدوية. أي من التالي هو من المضاعفات الأكثر شيوعا إذا بقي هذا المريض دون علاج؟
column11: A 33-year-old male comes to the clinic with a 4-day history of chest pain. The pain radiates to the right side of the neck and is worsened by deep inspiration and improved by leaning forward. Several weeks ago he had a fever and cough, which have both since improved. He is afebrile, BP is 130/85, and pulse is 88. On examination, there is a scratching sound heard over the left sternal border on expiration. ECG shows ST elevation in leads I, II, III, avL, and V₂ to V₆. The patient is offered treatment but refuses all medications. Which of the following is the most common complication if this disease remains untreated?

column4: امرأة تبلغ من العمر 52 عاما تعاني من داء سكري وفرط ضغط الدم، تحضر إلى قسم الطوارئ وهي تشكو من حرارة، قشعريرة وألم بطني. لقد بدأت الأعراض منذ حوالي أسبوع وتزداد سوءا. الألم البطني مترافق مع غثيان وإقياء، ولم تكن قادرة على تناول الطعام. عند الفحص، كانت حرارتها 38.9°س، ضغط الدم 104/68 ملم زئبق، سرعة القلب 94/د، وسرعة التنفس 16/د. يظهر الفحص البطني ألم في الجهة اليمنى عند الجس العميق، وإيلام شديد في الزاوية الضلعية الفقرية اليمنى. يظهر الفحص المخبري كثرة كريات دم بيضاء (15.400/ مم³) ويظهر تحليل البول كريات دم بيضاء، أسطوانات كريات دم بيضاء، بروتين، وجراثيم. بالرغم من إعطائها سيفترياكسون وريدي لمدة 5 أيام، لا تزال المريضة تعاني من ارتفاع حرارة. زرع بول المريضة هو إيجابي للإشريكية القولونية وهي حساسة لسيفترياكسون وسيبروفلوكساسين. ما هي الخطوة التالية الأنسب في التدبير العلاجي؟
column6: مسح طبقي محوري مع مادة ظليلة
column11: A 52-year-old woman with a history of diabetes mellitus and hypertension presents to the emergency department with fevers, chills, and abdominal pain. The symptoms began about 1 week ago and have been getting worse. The abdominal pain is associated with nausea and vomiting, and she has not been able to eat. On examination, her temperature is 38.9°C, blood pressure is 104/68 mm Hg, heart rate is 94/min, and respiratory rate is 16/min. Her abdominal examination shows right-sided pain to deep palpation, and she has severe right-sided costovertebral angle tenderness. Laboratories demonstrate a leukocytosis (15,400/mm³) and urinalysis shows WBCs, WBC casts, protein, and bacteria. Despite IV ceftriaxone for 5 days, the patient remains febrile. The patient's urine culture is positive for Escherichia coli and is sensitive to ceftriaxone and ciprofloxacin. What is the appropriate next step in management?

column4: لقد تم استدعاؤك لتقييم امرأة تبلغ من العمر 33 عاما تعاني من ضيق تنفس وتسرع قلب. هي تأخذ عادة فلوتيكازون والبوتيرول استنشاقي للربو، لكنها لم تعد تستجيب للألبوتيرول. عند الفحص، تبدو قلقة وتعاني ضيق تنفس معتدل. هناك أزيز ثنائي الجانب عند الفحص السريري، مع طور شهيقي وزفيري مديد واستخدام لعضلات تنفس مساعدة. الحرارة = 37.4°س، النبض = 116، ضغط الدم = 116/56، سرعة التنفس = 36. إشباع الأوكسجين 91% في جو الغرفة. يظهر الفحص استخدام عضلات مساعدة عند الشهيق. يظهر غاز الدم الشرياني PH=7.4، PO2=60 ملم زئبق، وPCO2=40 ملم زئبق. ما هي الخطوة التالية المناسبة في التدبير العلاجي لهذه المريضة؟
column11: You are paged to come and evaluate a 33-year-old female with shortness of breath and tachycardia. She normally takes inhaled fluticasone and albuterol for asthma, however she is not currently responding to the albuterol. On examination, she appears anxious and is moderately short of breath. There are loud bilateral wheezes on examination, with a prolonged inspiratory and expiratory phase and use of accessory muscles of respiration. Temperature = 37.4°C, pulse = 116, BP = 116/56, RR = 36. Oxygen saturation is 91% on room air. Examination shows use of accessory muscles on inspiration. An arterial blood gas is obtained and shows a pH of 7.4, PO₂ of 60 mm Hg, and PCO₂ of 40 mm Hg. What is the appropriate next step to be taken in the management of this patient?

The lesions were initially papules, then became vesicular, and finally pustular. Lesions at all three stages are seen. What is the most probable diagnosis?

column4: Un homme de 64 ans se présente à votre bureau avec une douleur au genou gauche gonflée. Il a des douleurs occasionnelles aux deux genoux qui sont généralement sourdes et disparaissent avec l'acétaminophène. Au cours des derniers jours, il a eu un gonflement qui a rendu difficile le mouvement de l'articulation. Il y a un an, il avait eu un épisode similaire de gonflement qui s'était résolu de lui-même, mais cet épisode est beaucoup plus grave. Il nie tout traumatisme précédent. Il nie toute raideur matinale. Il a aussi légèrement mal au genou droit, et ne le dérange pas beaucoup. À l'examen physique, il présente un épanchement modéré au genou gauche recouvert d'érythème (pas d'épanchement au genou droit). Il a un crepitus aux deux genoux. La force est normale et l'examen ne révèle aucune instabilité ligamentaire. La radiographie montre un léger rétrécissement de l'interligne articulaire et une calcification du cartilage. L'aspiration de l'épanchement révèle un fluide de couleur jaune, 25 000 GB, 85% de polymorphonucléaire, la coloration de Gram et la culture sont négatifs. L'évaluation des cristaux ne révèle pas de cristaux intracellulaires négativement biréfringents, mais révèle de multiples cristaux intracellulaires de forme rhomboïde biréfringente. Quel est le test de laboratoire le plus approprié à obtenir?
column11: A 64-year-old male presents to your office with left knee pain swelling. He has occasional pain in both knees that is usually dull and resolves with acetaminophen. Over the past few days, he has had swelling which has made it difficult to move the joint. He had a similar episode of swelling a year ago that resolved on its own but this episode is much more sever. He denies any preceding trauma. He denies any morning stiffness. He has pain in his right knee as well, but it is mild and does not bother him that much. On physical examination, he has a moderate effusion in his left knee with erythema overlying (no effusion in the right knee). He has crepitus in both knees. Strength is normal, and examination does not indicate any ligamentous instability. X-ray shows mild narrowing of the joint space and calcification of the cartilage. Aspiration of the effusion reveals straw-colored fluid, 25,000 WBCs, 85% polymorphonuclear. Gram stain and culture are negative. Evaluation for crystals reveals no intracellular negatively birefringent crystals, but does reveal multiple intracellular positively birefringent rhomboid-shaped crystals. What is the most appropriate laboratory test to obtain?

column4: Une femme de 53 ans se présente à l'hôpital avec des douleurs abdominales. Une cholécystite a été diagnostiquée et une cholécystectomie a été pratiquée. Le lendemain, elle se plaint de palpitations. Lors de son interrogatoire, elle a eu des battements de cœur irréguliers au cours des derniers mois, mais a considérablement empiré pendant cet épisode. Elle note également une perte de poids de 7 kg au cours du dernier mois. Elle nie les vertiges, la syncope, la dyspnée ou les douleurs à la poitrine. Elle a des antécédents d'hyperlipidémie, mais elle est par ailleurs en bonne santé. Les médicaments comprennent l'acide acétylsalicylique et l'atorvastatine. Éléments vitaux: Température = 39,1°C, pression artérielle = 155/88 mm Hg, pouls = 134. Saturation en oxygène à l'air ambiant = 96%. Examen physique: la patiente est agitée et semble confuse, répondant parfois à des questions de manière inappropriée. La peau est diaphorétique. Le cou est souple indolore et sans nodules palpables ni élargissement. L'examen cardiaque révèle un rythme irrégulier, une tachycardie et l'absence de murmures. L'ECG confirme la fibrillation auriculaire avec une réponse ventriculaire rapide. Thyréostimuline est <0,01 mU / L. Quelle est la prochaine étape la plus appropriée dans la prise en charge de ce patient?
column11: A 53-year-old female presents to the hospital with abdominal pain. She is diagnosed with cholecystitis and has a cholecystectomy performed. The following day she complains of palpitations. On questioning she has had an irregular heart beat off/on for the past few months but acutely worsened during this episode. She also notes a 7 kg weight loss over the past month. She denies dizziness, syncope, dyspnea, or chest pain. She has a known history of hyperlipidemia but has otherwise been healthy. Medications include acetylsalicylic acid and atorvastatin. Vitals: Temperature = 39.1°C, BP = 155/88 mm Hg, pulse = 134, Oxygen saturation at room air = 96%. Physical examination: patient is agitated an appears confused, sometimes answering questions inappropriately. Skin is diaphoretic. Neck is supple without tenderness and no palpable nodules or enlargement. Cardiac examination reveals an irregular rhythm, tachycardia, and no murmurs. ECG confirms atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response. Thyroid stimulating hormone is <0.01 mU/L. What is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

column4: Un homme de 61 ans qui est votre patient depuis plusieurs années présente à votre bureau une plainte pour deux épisodes d'urine sanglante au cours des dernières 24 heures. Il nie toute douleur au flanc, la dysurie, la fièvre ou les frissons. Son flux d'urine est puissant, il est capable de vider complètement et il nie le besoin de commencer / arrêter ou de forcer pendant la miction. L'histoire médicale est significative pour l'hyperlipidémie, l'hypertension, le diabète, le glaucome et l'arthrose. Il fume un paquet de cigarettes par jour depuis 35 à 40 ans. L'examen physique ne révèle aucun angle costovertébral ni sensibilité sus-pubienne. L'examen de la prostate révèle que la prostate n'est pas douloureuse, mais n'est pas élargie. L'analyse d'urine montre une hématurie sans protéinurie, sans pyurie ni cylindres de globules rouges. Cr = 1,1 mg / dL. La culture d'urine est négative. Quelle est la prochaine étape appropriée dans la gestion de ce patient?
column11: A 61-year-old male who has been your patient for several years presents to your office with a complaint of two episodes of bloody urine over the past 24 hours. He denies any flank pain, dysuria, fevers, or chills. His urine stream is strong, he is able to void completely and he denies the need to start/stop or strain during urination. Past medical history is significant for hyperlipidemia, hypertension, diabetes, glaucoma, and osteoarthritis. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes per day for the past 35 to 40 years. Physical examination reveals no costovertebral angle or suprapubic tenderness. Prostate examination reveals nontender, nonenlarged prostate. Urinalysis shows gross hematuria without proteinuria, pyuria, or red blood cells casts. Cr = 1.1 mg/dL. Urine culture is negative. What is the appropriate next step in managing this patient?

column4: Un homme de 57 ans se présente à votre bureau avec une histoire de toux depuis 2 semaines. La toux est associée à des expectorations claires, se produit quotidiennement et a persisté au cours des 2 dernières semaines. Il a parfois une dyspnée et une respiration sifflante. Il nie les myalgies, les fièvres ou les frissons. Il a ressenti un malaise à la poitrine en raison d'une toux excessive. L'histoire médicale est négative et il ne prend aucun médicament et nie tout antécédent de maladie pulmonaire. La température est de 37,2°C. FR = 18. La saturation en O₂ est de 96% à l'air ambiant. À l'examen, le patient n'est pas en détresse respiratoire et respire confortablement. L'auscultation des poumons révèle des rhonchi et une respiration sifflante épars mais pas de consolidation, d'égophonie ni de craquements. La radiographie thoracique montre une expansion normale des poumons sans infiltrations ni épanchements. Le débit de pointe est de 530 L / min (556 L / min prévu). Quelle est la gestion la plus appropriée?
column11: A 57-year-old male presents to your office with a 2-week history of cough. The cough is associated with clear sputum, occurs daily and has persisted over the past 2 weeks. He has occasional dyspnea and wheezing at times. He denies myalgias, fevers, or chills. He has experienced chest discomfort due to excessive coughing. Past medical history is negative and he takes no medications and specifically denies any history of pulmonary disease. Temperature is 37.2°C. RR = 18. O₂ saturation is 96% on room air. On examination, the patient is in no respiratory distress and is breathing comfortably. Auscultation of lungs reveals scattered rhonchi and wheezing but no consolidation, egophony, or crackles. Chest X-ray shows normal expansion of the lungs without infiltrates or effusions. Peak flow is 530 L/min (expected 556 L/min). What is the most appropriate management?

column4: Un adolescent de 14 ans a une éruption cutanée extrêmement prurigineuse des mains, des pieds et des organes génitaux. Il y a des terriers linéaires dans les plis des mains et des pieds et des nodules sur le scrotum. Quel organisme est la cause la plus probable de sa présentation?
column11: A 14-year-old adolescent male has an intensely pruritic rash of the hands, feet, and genitals. There are linear burrows in the creases of the hands and feet, and nodules on the scrotum. Which organism is the most likely cause of his presentation?

column4: Chez un enfant de 3 ans souffrant d'otorrhée persistante, quelle pathologie doit être suspectée?
column11: In a 3-year-old child with persistent otorrhea, one would suspect which of the following?

column4: Un homme de 32 ans, qui a récemment déménagé dans la région, se présente pour la première fois à votre bureau pour un examen de routine. L'histoire médicale est significative pour un diabète de type II. Il mesure 175 cm et pèse 98 kg. Le seul médicament qu'il prend est la metformine. Il fume un demi-paquet de cigarettes par jour, ne boit pas d'alcool; et exerce sporadiquement, environ une fois toutes les 2 semaines. Sa mère est décédée à l'âge de 62 ans des suites d'un infarctus du myocarde. Son père a 73 ans et est en bonne santé. L'examen physique est normal. Les signes vitaux sont: TA = 146/95, pouls = 73, FR = 19, température = 36,7°C. Parmi les modifications de mode de vie suivantes, laquelle a été démontrée comme entraînant la plus grande réduction de la pression artérielle?
column5: Régime DASH (Approches alimentaires pour éradiquer l'hypertension)
column11: A 32-year-old male, who recently moved to the area, presents to your office for the first time for a routine checkup. Past medical history is significant for type II diabetes mellitus. He is 175 cm and weighs 98 kg. The only medication he takes is metformin. He smokes half a pack of cigarettes a day; does not drink alcohol; and exercises sporadically, approximately once every 2 weeks. His mother died at the age of 62 due to a myocardial infarction. His father is 73 years of age and is healthy. Physical examination is normal. Vital Signs are: BP = 146/95, pulse = 73, RR = 19, temperature = 36.7°C. Which of the following lifestyle modifications has been shown to result in the greatest reduction in blood pressure?
column12: Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH) diet

column4: Une femme de 17 ans est dirigée vers le service des urgences par son médecin traitant; elle présente des antécédents de fièvre, de dysurie et de vomissements au cours des trois derniers jours. Elle nie les pertes vaginales, les douleurs abdominales ou la diarrhée. Elle est sexuellement active. Les signes vitaux sont les suivants: Température = 39.4°C, FR = 20, TA = 98/65, pouls = 100. Elle semble malade et ne tolère pas les liquides, mais elle est alerte et orientée. Son examen est positif pour la douleur sus-pubienne ainsi que pour la sensibilité bilatérale aux angles costo-vertébraux. L'analyse d'urine révèle de nombreux leucocytes et bactéries, et elle est positive pour les vomissements de leucocytes et l'estérase leucocytaire. Les autres résultats d'études de laboratoire se situent dans les limites normales, y compris un test de grossesse urinaire négatif. Quel est le diagnostic probable?
column11: A 17-year-old female is referred to the emergency department by her primary physician; she presents with a 3-day history of fevers, dysuria, and vomiting. She denies vaginal discharge, abdominal pain, or diarrhea. She is sexually active with her boyfriend. Vital Signs are as follows: Temperature = 39.4°C, RR = 20, BP = 98/65, pulse = 100. She appears ill and is unable to tolerate liquids, but she is alert and oriented. Her examination is positive for suprapubic as well as costovertebral angle tenderness bilaterally. Urinalysis reveals numerous white blood cells and bacteria, and it is positive for white blood cell casts and leukocyte esterase. Other laboratory study results are within normal limits, including a negative urine pregnancy test. What is the likely diagnosis?

column4: Un homme de 32 ans se présente au service d'urgence pour se plaindre d'une grave douleur au bas du dos au cours des 5 dernières semaines. Il rapporte que la douleur est plus intense au réveil le matin et qu'il s'améliore progressivement avec l'activité physique tout au long de la journée. Il ne peut se souvenir d'aucun traumatisme au dos lorsque la douleur a commencé. Il nie toute douleur ou engourdissement dans les membres inférieurs. La fonction de l'intestin et de la vessie est normale. L'examen physique révèle un homme en surpoids modéré. Il a très peu de douleur à la palpation de son bas du dos. L'examen neurologique est normal. Quelle est la prochaine étape appropriée dans la gestion de ce patient?
column11: A 32-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a complaint of severe low back pain for the last 5 weeks. He reports that the pain is most severe when he first wakes up in the morning and gradually improves with exercise throughout the day. He cannot recall any trauma or insult to his back when the pain started. He denies any pain or numbness in the lower extremities. Bowel and bladder function is normal. Physical examination reveals a moderately overweight male in some distress. He has very minimal tenderness on palpation of his low back. Neurologic examination is normal. What is the appropriate next step in managing this patient?

column4: Un homme de 29 ans ayant des antécédents d'asthme se présente à l'urgence avec un essoufflement sévère au cours des 2 derniers jours. Il se plaint également de maux de gorge, de malaises généralisés et d'une toux non productive. Il nie les douleurs à la poitrine, la fièvre et les frissons. Température = 37,1°C, FC = 95, FR = 33, TA = 140/82 et saturation en O₂ = 90% à l'air ambiant. La respiration est pénible et il parle à mi-voix. L'auscultation pulmonaire révèle une respiration sifflante expiratoire diffuse bilatérale. Il n'y a pas d'urticaire ni d'œdème de Quincke à l'examen cutané, les gaz du sang sont: 7.42 / 43/70/22. Quelle est la prochaine étape appropriée dans la gestion de ce patient?
column5: Administration prudente d'oxygène, ciblant une SaO₂ <94% pour prévenir l'hypercapnie
column11: A 29-year-old male with a history of asthma presents to the emergency department with severe shortness of breath for the past 2 days. He also complains of sore throat, generalized malaise, and a nonproductive cough. He denies chest pain, fever, and chills. Temperature = 37.1°C, HR = 95, RR = 33, BP = 140/82, and O₂ saturation = 90% on room air. Breathing is labored, and he is speaking in short gasps. Lung auscultation reveals bilateral diffuse expiratory wheezing. There is no urticaria or angioedema on skin examination. Arterial blood gases is drawn: 7.42/43/70/22. What is the appropriate next step in managing this patient?
column12: Cautious oxygen administration, targeting an SaO₂<94% to prevent hypercapnia

column4: Un enfant de 5 ans présente des difficultés à respirer et à avaler. Lors de l'examen physique, l'enfant est fébrile, tachycardique et tachypnéique. Il est anxieux, en train de baver et devient de plus en plus épuisé en luttant pour respirer. Quelle est la conduite thérapeutique la plus appropriée chez ce patient?
column5: Examiner la cavité buccale au chevet du patient
column7: Intubation endotrachéale immédiate au service des urgences
column8: Intubation endotrachéale immédiate en salle d'opération
column11: A 5-year-old presents with difficulty breathing and swallowing. On physical examination, the child is febrile, tachycardic, and tachypneic. He is anxious, drooling, and becomes increasingly exhausted while struggling to breathe. Which of the following is the most appropriate management of this patient?
column12: Examine the oral cavity at bedside
column14: Immediate endotracheal intubation in the emergency department
column15: Immediate endotracheal intubation in the operating room

column4: Pour quelle raison le surfactant exogène est souvent administré au nouveau-né?
column5: Le bébé a un faible poids à la naissance et une détresse respiratoire
column6: Prévenir le syndrome de détresse respiratoire chez les prématurés
column7: On diagnostique chez le nouveau-né une maladie des membranes hyalines
column11: Exogenous surfactant often is administered to neonates for which of the following reasons?
column12: The infant has a low birth weight and respiratory distress
column13: To prevent respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants
column14: The newborn is diagnosed with hyaline membrane disease

column4: Une femme de 22 ans se présente aux urgences avec une éruption cutanée soudaine, une forte fièvre et des vomissements. Les signes vitaux sont les suivants: Température = 40°C, FC = 118, FR = 22, TA = 76/40 et Oxymétrie de pouls = 98% à l'air ambiant. À l'examen, elle semble confuse et désorientée. Sa peau est chaude et il y a une éruption maculaire diffuse sur son corps. Elle est admise à l'unité des soins intensifs et développe par la suite un dysfonctionnement d'organes multisystèmes. Lequel des organismes suivants est le plus probablement impliqué dans le diagnostic de ce patient?
column11: A 22-year-old female presents to the emergency department with abrupt onset of a rash, high fever, and vomiting. Vital signs are as follows: Temperature = 40°C, HR = 118, RR = 22, BP = 76/40, and pulse oximetry = 98% on room air. On examination, she appears confused and disoriented. Her skin is warm, and there is a diffuse macular rash over her body. She is admitted to the intensive care unit and subsequently develops multisystem organ dysfunction. Which of the following organisms is most likely implicated in this patient's diagnosis?

column4: Un homme âgé de 33 ans se présente à la clinique avec des antécédents de douleur thoracique depuis 4 jours. La douleur irradie du côté droit du cou est aggravée par une inspiration profonde et améliorée en se penchant en avant. Il y a plusieurs semaines, il a eu de la fièvre et de la toux, qui se sont améliorées depuis. Il est apyrétique, TA est à 130/85 et le pouls à 88. À l'examen, vous entendez un grattement audible sur la bordure sternale gauche à l'expiration. L'ECG montre l'élévation du segment ST dans les dérivations I, II, III, avL, et V₂ à V₆. Le patient se voit proposer un traitement mais refuse tous les médicaments. Laquelle des complications suivantes est la plus fréquente si cette maladie n'est pas traitée?
column8: Rupture de la paroi libre ventriculaire
column11: A 33-year-old male comes to the clinic with a 4-day history of chest pain. The pain radiates to the right side of the neck and is worsened by deep inspiration and improved by leaning forward. Several weeks ago he had a fever and cough, which have both since improved. He is afebrile, BP is 130/85, and pulse is 88. On examination, there is a scratching sound heard over the left sternal border on expiration. ECG shows ST elevation in leads I, II, III, avL, and V₂ to V₆. The patient is offered treatment but refuses all medications. Which of the following is the most common complication if this disease remains untreated?

column4: Une femme de 52 ans ayant des antécédents de diabète sucré et d'hypertension se présente au service des urgences en raison de fièvres, de frissons et de douleurs abdominales. Les symptômes ont commencé il y a environ une semaine et ont empiré. La douleur abdominale est associée à des nausées et des vomissements, et elle n'a pas pu manger. À l'examen, sa température est de 38,9°C, sa pression artérielle est de 104/68 mm Hg, sa fréquence cardiaque est de 94 / min et sa fréquence respiratoire est de 16 / min. Son examen abdominal montre une douleur du côté droit à la palpation profonde et elle présente une sensibilité douloureuse de l'angle costo-vertébral du côté droit. Les laboratoires présentent une leucocytose (15,400 / mm³) et une analyse d'urine montre les leucocytes, des cylindres de leucocytes, les protéines et les bactéries. Malgré l'administration intraveineuse de ceftriaxone pendant 5 jours, le patient reste fébrile. La culture d'urine du patient est positive pour Escherichia coli et est sensible à la ceftriaxone et à la ciprofloxacine. Quelle est la prochaine étape appropriée dans la gestion?
column8: Arrêter la ceftriaxone et démarrer la ciprofloxacine
column9: Arrêter la ceftriaxone et réculture urine
column11: A 52-year-old woman with a history of diabetes mellitus and hypertension presents to the emergency department with fevers, chills, and abdominal pain. The symptoms began about 1 week ago and have been getting worse. The abdominal pain is associated with nausea and vomiting, and she has not been able to eat. On examination, her temperature is 38.9°C, blood pressure is 104/68 mm Hg, heart rate is 94/min, and respiratory rate is 16/min. Her abdominal examination shows right-sided pain to deep palpation, and she has severe right-sided costovertebral angle tenderness. Laboratories demonstrate a leukocytosis (15,400/mm³) and urinalysis shows WBCs, WBC casts, protein, and bacteria. Despite IV ceftriaxone for 5 days, the patient remains febrile. The patient's urine culture is positive for Escherichia coli and is sensitive to ceftriaxone and ciprofloxacin. What is the appropriate next step in management?

column4: Vous êtes demandé à venir évaluer une femme de 33 ans présentant un essoufflement et une tachycardie. Elle prend normalement du fluticasone et de l'albutérol par inhalation pour l'asthme, mais elle ne répond pas actuellement à l'albutérol. À l'examen, elle semble angoissée et a le souffle court. Lors de l'examen, on observe une respiration sifflante bilatérale forte, avec une phase inspiratoire et expiratoire prolongée et l'utilisation de muscles accessoires de la respiration. Température = 37,4°C, impulsion = 116, pression artérielle = 116/56, FR = 36. La saturation en oxygène est de 91% à l'air ambiant. L'examen montre l'utilisation de muscles accessoires à l'inspiration. Un gaz sanguin artériel est obtenu et présente un pH de 7,4, une PO₂ de 60 mm Hg et une PCO₂ de 40 mm Hg. Quelle est la prochaine étape appropriée à suivre dans la prise en charge de ce patient?
column11: You are paged to come and evaluate a 33-year-old female with shortness of breath and tachycardia. She normally takes inhaled fluticasone and albuterol for asthma, however she is not currently responding to the albuterol. On examination, she appears anxious and is moderately short of breath. There are loud bilateral wheezes on examination, with a prolonged inspiratory and expiratory phase and use of accessory muscles of respiration. Temperature = 37.4°C, pulse = 116, BP = 116/56, RR = 36. Oxygen saturation is 91% on room air. Examination shows use of accessory muscles on inspiration. An arterial blood gas is obtained and shows a pH of 7.4, PO₂ of 60 mm Hg, and PCO₂ of 40 mm Hg. What is the appropriate next step to be taken in the management of this patient?

column4: Lequel des souffles cardiaques suivants suggère la présence d'une petite communication inter ventriculaire chez un garçon de 13 ans?

column11: Which of the following murmurs suggests the presence of a small ventricular septal defect in a 13-year-old male?
column12: Loud holosystolic murmur at the 3rd and 4th intercostal spaces along left sternal border
column13: Systolic ejection murmur at left sternal border with a diastolic rumble
column14: Holosystolic murmur heard between the scapula

column4: En relación con el metabolismo del hierro y su control mediado por hepcidina, es cierto que:
column5: La caída en la presión parcial de oxígeno promueve la activación del factor inducible por hipoxia (HIF), que aumenta la expresión de hepcidina.

column7: La hepcidina disminuye la absorción intestinal de hierro a través de la inactivación del transportador de metales bivalentes 1 (DMT1).

column11: Regarding iron metabolism and its hepcidin-mediated control, it is true that:
column12: The drop in oxygen partial pressure promotes the activation of hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF), which increases hepcidin expression.

column4: ¿Cuál de las siguientes alteraciones bioquímicas se observa en el reordenamiento metabólico de la diabetes mellitus?:
column5: La disminución de la traslocación de los transportadores de glucosa GLUT2 y GLUT4 desde las vesículas de almacenamiento intracelular a la membrana plasmática.
column6: El aumento de la producción de urea por una mayor degradación nucleotídica.
column7: El incremento de la síntesis hepática de triglicéridos.
column8: El aumento de la síntesis hepática de glicerol como sustrato gluconeogénico.
column11: Which of the following biochemical alterations is observed in the metabolic rearrangement of diabetes mellitus?

column13: Increased urea production due to increased nucleotide degradation.
column15: Increased hepatic synthesis of glycerol as a gluconeogenic substrate.

column4: Una persona sana sufre una deshidratación tras realizar ejercicio físico intenso a altas temperaturas sin ingerir líquidos. Respecto a la activación del sistema renina-angiotensina- aldosterona en esas condiciones, señale la respuesta INCORRECTA:

column8: Aumenta la secreción renal de potasio.
column11: A healthy person suffers dehydration after performing intense physical exercise at high temperatures without drinking fluids. Regarding the activation of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system under these conditions, select the INCORRECT answer:
column12: Changes in blood pressure are accompanied by proportional changes in glomerular filtration.

column14: Increases the activity of the supraoptic and paraventricular hypothalamic nuclei.

column8: El músculo supraespinoso ayuda a la aducción (aproximación) del brazo.
column11: Of the following statements related to the anatomical structures that form the rotator cuff, select the correct one:

column15: The supraspinatus muscle helps adduct (bring closer) the arm.

column4: ¿Cuál de las siguientes características de la anatomía del esófago es la que facilita la realización de la ecocardiografía transesofágica?:

column11: Which of the following features of esophageal anatomy facilitates the performance of transesophageal echocardiography?

column4: Una persona joven y sana se encuentra en posición anatómica erguida. En relación con el flujo sanguíneo a través de los pulmones y su distribución, señale la respuesta INCORRECTA:

column6: El ejercicio aumenta el flujo sanguíneo en todas las regiones pulmonares.
column7: El aumento del gasto cardiaco durante el ejercicio intenso es asumido por la circulación pulmonar sin grandes aumentos en la presión arterial pulmonar.
column8: Una disminución significativa de la concentración de O2 en los alveolos provoca una vasodilatación de los vasos adyacentes.
column11: A young, healthy person is in an upright position. Regarding blood flow through the lungs and its distribution, select the incorrect answer:
column12: At rest, flow at the pulmonary apices is usually intermittent.
column13: Exercise increases blood flow to all lung regions.
column14: The increase in cardiac output during intense exercise is met by the pulmonary circulation without significant increases in pulmonary artery pressure.
